abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Avian Influenza
            Control Project are to minimize the threat in Nepal posed to
            humans by Highly Pathogenic Avian Influenza (HPAI) infection
            and other zoonotic diseases by controlling such infections
            among domestic poultry and to prepare for, control, and
            respond to an influenza epidemic and other related
            infectious disease emergencies in humans. The reallocation
            is necessary for Department of Livestock (DOLS) to prevent
            and manage the potential outbreaks in coming winter months,
            when the Influenza A (H1N1) and Avian Influenza (H5N1) virus
            is most active in Nepal, Bangladesh and India. Despite the
            project expenditure has reached only 57 percent, DOLS
            indicates that the funds have already been committed to
            civil works and equipments with the balance of US$ 200,000
            until the end of the project, i.e., July 31, 2011. The
            requested reallocation is, therefore, to provide continued
            support for field veterinary services, enhancement of
            laboratory capacity and project coordination unit.
